justification: The article states that "the drift rate parameter is thought to map into how easy the task is for a specific person, being some combination of the person's ability ... with easier tasks resulting in higher drift rates."

It notes that "Decision threshold is thought to map onto a person's decision strategy regarding their speed-accuracy tradeoff, where participants can either raise their threshold to respond more slowly with greater accuracy, or lower their threshold to respond more quickly with lesser accuracy."

The text explains that "Non-decision time is thought to map onto how quickly perceptual processes feed into the decision process, and how quickly motor processes operate after a decision is made, with slower perceptual processing and/or slower motor movement resulting in longer non-decision times."
